column1: Awesome. So now that you guys have experienced VR and then also watch some scenarios on it. We just want to give you a chance to talk about what you think with VR. So, you chose the home and the school scenarios. What did you think about the use of VR in these stories? What part of the stories stood out to you?

Ummm, the online learning stood out actually. I  remember doing it during COVID, and I think it is a good way to do things. but are probably did not allow kids, to make like, human interaction with friendships
Yeah, for sure. You kinda mentioned the human interaction part, but what kind of other problems you see, like VR might create for US kids.
Like too much screen time...not enough time being outside.
Yeah, for sure. Who do you think should decide which VR experiences are a good choice for children?
When a VR maker start reading these VR experiences for these children and their families, what are some important things that they should keep in mind?

Maybe Like, implement like, things where the parents can control screen time on it. Like it shut downs after a certain point. Or if it is like a school setup, they can make sure like, they still get human interaction with it.
Yeah, Is there anything else you want to share about VR for kids, or for your own experiences in them?
